website_summaries.verdict: A Common Core-aligned curriculum that focuses on expression through the 5-step writing process.
pros: Different lessons teach writing to express opinions and to inform, as well as narrative pieces
Reinforces grammar and language arts skills
Includes CD-ROM to print exercise pages
cons: Some third graders may not be ready for later material

customer_reviews.title: Well organized and CD-ROM included!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my daughter to use for our homeschool. I liked how it gave specific tasks for each day rather than just a writing prompt. The topics are interesting to her and challenge her to write about things she wouldn't naturally choose to write about. But why I'm really leaving a positive review is because it comes with a CD-ROM!! NO MORE Xeroxing papers! I can just print them directly from the disc! The entire workbook is on there. I can print pages as needed for her to complete, but have the book next to me. Maybe I'm geeking out a bit... but it's something I wasn't expecting in my purchase but am so so thrilled to have!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: Finally a curriculum that works!
customer_reviews.text: Love this curriculum! I'm homeschooling and got 5 core subjects for my 3rd grader (Math, Reading, Writing, Science, and Social Studies). The assignments are well thought out and meet standardized test standards. Each lesson builds on the last. My ADHD son is doing the work in double time. I'm so grateful for this curriculum!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Mahar

customer_reviews.title: This is an amazing resource for teachers
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing resource for teachers. You do need to have prior knowledge on how to teach narrative, informational, and opinion forms of writing. The curriculum spirals and aligns to CCSS which is great for students with limited attention spans. You can teach the content in small bites and it is really evident if the student is making progress or has mastered the standard. It is also a great tool for gathering standards based data and using the data to plan next steps for instruction.
customer_reviews.author: Savage designs

customer_reviews.title: Good resource for teaching writing in lower grades or special education
customer_reviews.text: I used the 2nd grade book last year with my 4th/5th grade special education class and saw more improvement in their writing over the year than I saw in past years. Bought the 3rd grade version for this year to continue building. Love that there are lessons for each day of the week and each week of the school year and a CD with the worksheets is included.
customer_reviews.author: Tracykg

customer_reviews.title: Good book for homeschooling
customer_reviews.text: Great prompts and guidance for practice for my homeschooler. Just what we were looking for to give us some direction and inspiration to practice writing and grammar.
customer_reviews.author: NicoleTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Choose something else
customer_reviews.text: Ehhhhh. It’s ok. Not what I thought it would be. I love the 180 days series, but this one is not up to par with what I expected. Probably won’t use it much, if at all.
customer_reviews.author: Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Good content for my 3rd grader
customer_reviews.text: Got this book for my third grade son to help supplement some of his school work now that the classroom is staying virtual and he only types for school. Looks like it’s good for his grade level and purpose we bought it for. Only gave three stars because the book came clearly used. The first couple pages were already written in.
customer_reviews.author: Lacey Olson

customer_reviews.title: Step by step help
customer_reviews.text: Very good practice book. A lot of exercises and fine points to help improve writing. My son gained a lot of confidence finishing this book.
customer_reviews.author: Peng Yi

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase.
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my 3rd grader and she seems to be liking the book so far. I will update the review after a few weeks of use.
customer_reviews.author: RAH

customer_reviews.title: Worth it 100%
customer_reviews.text: I used this to teach my son during summer break and we loved it!!! It’s really helpful and fun! My son enjoyed it.
customer_reviews.author: Monica Maharaj

customer_reviews.title: Good condition
customer_reviews.text: I liked that even though I purchased a used version of it the whole book was not written on. Saved me time from having to go back and erase stuff.
customer_reviews.author: C.Espinosa

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This is a great workbook for my seven year old.
customer_reviews.author: Charles M Corona

customer_reviews.title: Best writing supplement I've found
customer_reviews.text: My daughter is in a foreign language school so I wanted her to continue practicing English writing. This is the right book for her. Well laid out to follow the pre writing, drafting, revising, editng process in weekly segments with new topics each week to keep it fresh
customer_reviews.author: Jay H

customer_reviews.title: Difficult
customer_reviews.text: A little more difficult than I expected for third grade.
customer_reviews.author: 3girls4boys

customer_reviews.title: Should Rename This Series
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book and the Fifth Grade one for my kids for homeschooling. To call this book "180 Days of Writing" is a big deception. I don't consider putting check marks next to boxes a day of writing. So many of the exercises in these books had absolutely no writing in them. The kids would draw lines or underline something. In the beginning my kids were excited to have something new for writing, but by the end of the second week they were dreading doing these books. I have put them on the shelves and will not be using them anymore. I'm not sure how these books got such a high rating. What a waste of money!
customer_reviews.author: Mari
